name: market for recultivation, bentonite mine | recultivation, bentonite mine | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/5849/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'recultivation, bentonite mine', in the Global geography.;This market contains no transport or losses, as they are irrelevant for the delivered product.;This is delivering the service of recultivation of a bentonite mine.  The process represents the transformation from bentonite extraction site to a land with no specif applicatio with a 33 m thickness soil coverage, 30 m overburden material and 3 m additional material. It includes the process of land transformation and the diesel consumption for refilling of overburden material. Any additional material and its transport to the mine are not included.	

This activity starts with the service generation.


This activity ends with the service supplied to its consumers. Transport or losses are considered irrelevant for this product.
